page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY OF PORTESSIE
page.content: THE NAME{PORTESSIE}COMES FROM THE FACT THAT IT WAS A{PORT}AND IT WAS A VERY{EASY}HARBOUR FOR THE FISHERMEN TO SAIL THEIR BOATS INTO. THERE IS A CHURCH, A SCHOOL AND A PLAY PARK IN THE AREA AS WELL AS RESIDENTIAL HOUSES. THE SCHOOL WAS BUILT AROUND 1940 AND TODAY HAS AROUND 100 PRIMARY PUPILS. THE CHURCH IN THE VILLAGE IS METHODIST. ITS MINISTER IS MR. D. ARCHER. THERE IS A CHURCH HALL ATTACHED TO THE CHURCH. THE PLAYPARK IS NEAR THE SCHOOL AND HAS SWINGS, A ROUNDABOUT AND A ROCKET. THE FOUR MAIN OCCUPATIONS OF THE MEN FOLK ARE FISHING, THE SLIP, FARMING AND OIL. THERE ARE TWO SHOPS, THE BUTCHERS AND A POST OFFICE. THE POST OFFICE IS A SUB OFFICE. IT IS ALSO A GENERAL STORE SELLING NEWSPAPERS TO SWEETS. { BY RACHEL WILSON AND SEAN LYONS.
